intro: Euphrasia orthocheila subsp. orthocheila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is known for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional herbal remedies for eye conditions. The subspecies orthocheila is distinguished by its narrow leaves and specific floral morphology compared to other subspecies of Euphrasia.
